{"step_by_step_thinking": "Metal oxides are added in porcelain for various purposes. To determine the purpose for which metal oxides are added, we need to analyze the information provided in the documents. Document [2] states that the oxides in porcelain dental alloys enhance the tensile strength of the non-precious alloy after porcelain fusion. Document [6] mentions that the addition of silver and platinum nanoparticles (which are metal oxides) improves the mechanical properties of porcelain. Document [8] states that metal oxides are used to create a more natural and aesthetic appearance in porcelain restorations. Based on this information, we can conclude that metal oxides are added in porcelain for strength, improving bonding, and cosmetic purposes.
